description: MTA-scale for Medial Temporal Lobe Atrophy (Scheltens Classification)

attributes.name: MTA scale
attributes.description:
The MTA-score (Scheltens) should be rated on coronal T1-weighted images, on a slice through the corpus of the hippocampus (level of the anterior pons). The scale is based on a visual score of the width of the choroid fissure, the width of the temporal horn, and the height of the hippocampal formation.
For patients that are less than 75 years: score 2 or more is abnormal. For patients that are older than 75 years: score 3 or more is abnormal.

values.name: MTA 1
values.description: Score 1: only widening of choroid fissure.

values.name: MTA2
values.description: Score 2: also widening of temporal horn of lateral ventricle.

values.name: MTA 3
values.description: Score 3: moderate loss of hippocampal volume (decrease in height).

values.name: MTA 4
values.description: Score 4: severe volume loss of hippocampus .
